{"id":528446799,"lang":"python3","time":"1 week, 1 day","timestamp":1627281572,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/528446799/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"N/A","code":"from typing import List\n\nclass Solution:\n    def findMedianSortedArrays(self, \n        larger: List[int], \n        smaller: List[int]) -> float:\n\n        if len(larger) < len(smaller):\n            return self.findMedianSortedArrays(smaller,larger)\n        \n        n1: int = len(larger)\n        n2: int = len(smaller)\n        \n        isEven: bool = (n1 + n2) % 2 == 0\n        halfLen: int = (n1 + n2 - 1) // 2\n            \n        if not n1:\n            return larger[halfLen] if not isEven else sum(larger[halfLen:halfLen+2]) / 2.0\n\n        left: int = 0\n        right: int = n2 - 1 \n\n        while (left <= right):\n            smallInd: int = (left + right) // 2\n            largeInd: int = halfLen - smallInd\n                \n            preSmall: int = smaller[smallInd - 1] if smallInd else -1\n            preLarge: int = larger[largeInd - 1] if largeInd else -1\n            smallVal: int = smaller[smallInd]\n            largeVal: int = larger[largeInd]\n            # print(preSmall,preLarge,smallVal,largeVal)\n            if preSmall > largeVal:\n                left = smallInd + 1\n            elif preLarge > smallVal:\n                right = smallInd - 1\n            else:\n                # print(smallInd,largeInd)\n                if isEven:\n                    return (smallVal + largeVal) / 2.0\n                else:\n                    return min(smallVal,largeVal)\n\n        return -1","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
